title_sort: richard maurice bucke to walt whitman, 12 september 1888
title: Richard Maurice Bucke to Walt Whitman, 12 September 1888
text: Superintendent's Office.ASYLUM FOR THE INSANELONDON. ONTARIOLondon, Ont.,12 Sept 1888Still keeps lovely weather here—in fact more and more pleasant if possible. I go this afternoon to Sarnia to attend (tomorrow morning) the wedding of Miss Pardee & Fred. Kittermaster—the latter a nephew of Mrs. Buckes'. I shall return here noon friday & probably write you that evening. Everything quiet here including the meter but we expect to be ready to make another step in the matter next week. I do not hear from Gilchrist—what is he doing? I suppose you see a good deal of him?Always affectionately yoursRM BuckeSee notes Sept 14, 1888 Richard Maurice Bucke to Walt Whitman, 12 September 1888
